intro: Erythraea ramosissima var. acutiflora, commonly known as the Redroot or Acute-flowered erythraea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of streams. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
